hanzi-su-wiki:
坊

Значения

Бонза, священник; келья, мальчик

Мнемоника

Место 土 в стороне 方 — помещение при монастыре, келья, а также монах, живущий отдельно, переулок.
purpleculture_pinyin:
fāng
lane (usually as part of a street name); memorial archway
переулок (обычно как часть названия улицы); мемориальная арка

fáng
workshop; mill; Taiwan pr. fang1
мастерская; мельница; Тайвань пр. клык1
rtega_mnemonic:
坊坊RScommunity, neighbourhood, workshop of a trade, boy, priest
  • square 方 place 土 where the apprentice (boy) studies
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 方 indicates the sound; 土 (earth) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
牌坊 [ pái fāng ]: memorial arch
坊间 [ fāng jiān ]: street stalls; bookshops; in the streets
香坊 [ xiāng fāng ]: Xiangfang district of Harbin 哈尔滨 in Heilongjiang
香坊区 [ xiāng fāng qū ]: Xiangfang district of Harbin 哈尔滨 in Heilongjiang
坊子 [ fāng zǐ ]: Fangzi district of Weifang city 潍坊市 , Shandong
碾坊 [ niǎn fáng ]: grain mill
磨坊 [ mò fáng ]: mill
廊坊 [ láng fáng ]: Langfang prefecture-level city in Hebei
廊坊市 [ láng fáng shì ]: Langfang prefecture-level city in Hebei
茶坊 [ chá fáng ]: teahouse
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 土 [ tǔ ] soil, earth; items made of earth
    • 方 [ fāng ] square, rectangle; side; region; flag
heisig_chinese_memo: Little boys always head in the direction of mud and dirt, but end up in their fathers workshop at the end of the day.
heisig_constituent: boy, soil, dirt, ground, compass, direction
heisig_story: The character for a boy shows us a Boy Scout cleaning the dirt out of his compass - the more dirt, the better.
koohiiStory1: Little boys always head in the direction of mud and dirt.
koohiiStory2: Boys thoughts often head in dirty directions.
jp_example_words:
坊ちゃん(ぼっちゃん): son (of others)
寝坊(ねぼう): sleeping in late
坊さん(ぼうさん): Buddhist priest, monk
坊や(ぼうや): boy
赤ん坊(あかんぼう): baby
朝寝坊(あさねぼう): over sleep
jp_readingExamples: 坊主 (ぼうず), 朝寝坊 (あさねぼう), 赤ん坊 (あかんぼう)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Can you look at the dirt and know which direction you need to go? Then you might be a monk. Monks have amazing skills like that. And I'm sure you've seen monks wandering around in lots of media. They don't need maps or smartphones. They just look at the dirt and let the earth guide them to where they need to be.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture a monk walking through a large field in the middle of nowhere. He knows where to go, he's not afraid. The dirt will lead him in the right direction.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You want to know the monk's trick so you hide behind him for a while as he walks. Finally the monk stops, looks around, takes out a bowling (ぼう) ball and starts bowling in the dirt. The bowling ball rolls off, the monk follows it, and then heads off in that direction.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine a monk bowling in the middle of the road. Imagine your shock at how well he handles the ball. Also, imagine how heavy it must be for a monk to carry a bowling ball everywhere!
Ru_trainchinese:
fáng: (сущ) мастерская, фабрика
fāng: (сущ) переулок, аллея (используется при названии улицы или переулка); мемориальная арка
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the way (方) of the ground (土) is learnt by a boy
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Little boys always head in the direction of mud and dirt, but end up in their fathers workshop at the end of the day.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " earth " to " fang " sound. "Wen said," No, " Square ", " anti- cloud under" word: "𨹛, or proof from the soil." Duan Note: "Suzi workshop is also run by, vulgar Square is again in the name of the town." Duan The judge thought that " fang " was a common word for " defense ." One said that " fang " is " 𨹛 " without the " 𨸏 " on the right. Zheng Zhen in the Qing Dynasty, "Shu Wen Xin Attached Kao": "The Han people went to "Fu" and transferred "Tu" to "Fang". Later generations thought that the proper name of Yili."

" Fang " means an alley in the city. "Shuowen Xinfu": "Fang, the name of the town. From the soil, the sound of the square." Such as "Northern History. Biography of Wei Zhuzong House: "Huainan people took the lead to subscribe to more than 3,000 homes. It is located on the side of the east Rushui of the city, and the name is Guiyifang." "Old Tang Book. "Shi Hu Zhi 1": "Those who live in the town are the square, and those who live in the field are the village."

The "lifang system" is a form of capital planning in ancient times. It began in the Northern Wei Dynasty and refers to the division of a city into residential areas called " fangs ." The " squares " in the entire city present a checkerboard-like distribution. "Wei Shu. Sejong Ji: "In September, Dingyou, 50,000 people from Faji Nefu built a capital of 323 squares, and then at 40.” The Northern Wei Dynasty Yang Xuanzhi's "Luoyang Garanji" includes "Wurenfang", "Prince's Square", etc. .

The Lifang system was implemented in the Sui and Tang Dynasties. "Tang Six Codes. "Shangshuhuhubu": "The two capitals and the prefectures and counties are divided into squares, and the outskirts are villages." Taking Luoyang City as an example, Du Bao of the Tang Dynasty "Daye Zaji": "There are 96 squares in Luonan, Luobei There are thirty squares. Small streets on the main street are facing each other horizontally and horizontally.” According to archaeological findings, the Luoyang ruins in the Sui and Tang Dynasties were in the urban area of Luoyang and its suburbs today. Traces of more than 60 " fangs " have been found in the ruins. Other " fangs " may have been crushed under the present-day Luoyang city or destroyed by the Luo River.

" Fang " means " defense ", which means embankment. Such as "Warring States Policy. "Qin Ceyi": "Jiqing River is turbid, enough to limit; Great Wall Giant Square, enough to be the foundation." It also expresses prevention, such as "Book of Rites. "Fang Ji": "A gentleman rituals is a virtue, punishes a prostitution, and orders a man to desire."

" Fang " also refers to the workplace of handicraftsmen, such as workshops, wine shops, dyeing houses, etc. "Sui Shu. "Shihuozhi": "First of all, Shangyi's disadvantages on the weekend, the official wine shop reaps profits, and the salt wells in Yanchi are forbidden to be used by the common people." "Old Tang Book. "Suzong Ji": "From now on, I have often eaten and served imperial things, and have reduced from feasts, and all workshops have stopped."

" Fang " also means a shop. "Zhengzitong. "Tube": "Fang, the place of merchants' trade is also called a workshop." Such as the Northern Song Dynasty Meng Yuan, "Tokyo Dream Hualu. Panlou East Streets and Alleys": "The East Cross Street said from Xinglijiao, the tea shop lights up every five shifts, and Boyi buys and sells clothes, pictures, garlands, collar wipes, etc." Cao Xueqin of the Qing Dynasty, Chapter 23 of "A Dream of Red Mansions" : "(Ming Yan) After thinking about it, he walked to the bookstore."

" Fang " means an archway, a building used to commend virtue in ancient times, such as chastity archway, merit archway, etc. Such as Feng Menglong in the Ming Dynasty, "Ancient and Modern Novels. "Xianyun Temple Ruan San pays off the debts": "(Chen Zongruan) took his mother to be a widow at the age of 19, never marrying his whole life, teaching his son to become famous and other things, playing the court, and opening the archway of Jianxian Festival." Wu Jingzi in Qing Dynasty "Outside History" Chapter 48: "Two months later, the boss approved it, the master entered the temple, and the gate was built." It also refers to decorative archways, such as Xu Hongzu's "Xu Xiake's Travel Notes." "Dian Travel Diary 12": "There is an ancient workshop called Yunyin Temple in the mountain gate."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " earth " and " square ", it means the inner lanes in the city.
humanum_full_description:
從「土」，「方」聲。《說文》無「坊」，「防」字下云：「𨹛，防或从土。」段玉裁注：「俗字所由作坊也，俗又以坊為邑里之名。」段玉裁以為「坊」是「防」的俗字。一說「坊」是「𨹛」省去右邊的「𨸏」而成。清代鄭珍《說文新附考》：「漢人去『阜』移『土』成『坊』字，後人乃以為邑里專名。」

　　「坊」表示城中聚居的里巷。《說文新附》：「坊，邑里之名。从土，方聲。」如《北史．魏諸宗室傳》：「淮南人相率投附者三千餘家，置之城東汝水之側，名曰歸義坊。」《舊唐書．食貨志上》：「在邑居者為坊，在田野者為村。」

　　「里坊制」是古代一種都城規劃的形制，始於北魏，指把城市劃分成一個個居住區，稱為「坊」。整個城市的「坊」呈現棋盤式的分布。《魏書．世宗紀》：「九月丁酉，發畿內夫五萬人築京師三百二十三坊，四旬而罷。」北魏楊衒之《洛陽伽藍記》有「吳人坊」、「王子坊」等。

　　隋唐時期實行里坊制。《唐六典．尚書戶部》：「兩京及州縣之郭內分為坊，郊外為村。」以洛陽城為例，唐朝杜寶《大業雜記》：「洛南有九十六坊，洛北有三十坊。大街小陌，縱橫相對。」據考古發現，隋唐洛陽遺址在今洛陽城市區及近郊。遺址中已發現六十多個「坊」的痕跡，其他「坊」則可能被壓在今洛陽城下或被洛河沖毁。

　　「坊」通「防」，表示堤防。如《戰國策．秦策一》：「濟清河濁，足以為限；長城鉅坊，足以為基。」又表示防範，如《禮記．坊記》：「君子禮以坊德，刑以坊淫，命以坊欲。」

　　「坊」又表示手工業者的工作場所，如作坊、酒坊、染坊等。《隋書．食貨志》：「先是尚依周末之弊，官置酒坊收利，鹽池鹽井，皆禁百姓採用。」《舊唐書．肅宗紀》：「自今以後，朕常膳及服御等物，並從節減，諸作坊造坊並停。」

　　「坊」也表示店鋪。《正字通．土部》：「坊，商賈貿易之所亦曰坊。」如北宋孟元老《東京夢華錄．潘樓東街巷》：「又東十字大街曰從行裡角，茶坊每五更點燈，博易買賣衣服、圖畫、花環、領抹之類。」清代曹雪芹《紅樓夢》第23回：「（茗煙）想畢，便走到書坊內。」

　　「坊」表示牌坊，乃古代用以表彰品德的建築物，例如貞節牌坊、功德牌坊等。如明代馮夢龍《古今小說．閑雲庵阮三償冤債》：「（陳宗阮）將他母親十九歲上守寡，一生不嫁，教子成名等事，表奏朝廷，啟建賢節牌坊。」清代吳敬梓《儒林外史》第48回：「過了兩個月，上司批准下來，製主入祠，門首建坊。」又泛指裝飾性的牌樓，如明末徐弘祖《徐霞客遊記．滇遊日記十二》：「山門內有古坊曰雲隱寺。」
humanum_short_description: 從「土」，「方」聲，表示城中聚居的里巷。

It began in the Northern Wei Dynasty and refers to the division of a city into residential areas called " fangs." The " squares" in the entire city present a checkerboard-like distribution. "Wei Shu. Sejong Ji: "In September, Dingyou, 50,000 people from Faji Nefu built a capital of 323 squares, and then at 40.” The Northern Wei Dynasty Yang Xuanzhi's "Luoyang Garanji" includes "Wurenfang", "Prince's Square", etc. . The Lifang system was implemented in the Sui and Tang Dynasties. "Tang Six Codes. "Shangshuhuhubu": "The two capitals and the prefectures and counties are divided into squares, and the outskirts are villages." Taking Luoyang City as an example, Du Bao of the Tang Dynasty "Daye Zaji": "There are 96 squares in Luonan, Luobei There are thirty squares. Small streets on the main street are facing each other horizontally and horizontally.” According to archaeological findings, the Luoyang ruins in the Sui and Tang Dynasties were in the urban area of Luoyang and its suburbs today. Traces of more than 60 " fangs" have been found in the ruins. Other " fangs" may have been crushed under the present-day Luoyang city or destroyed by the Luo River. " Fang" means " defense", which means embankment. Such as "Warring States Policy. "Qin Ceyi": "Jiqing River is turbid, enough to limit; Great Wall Giant Square, enough to be the foundation." It also expresses prevention, such as "Book of Rites. "Fang Ji": "A gentleman rituals is a virtue, punishes a prostitution, and orders a man to desire." " Fang" also refers to the workplace of handicraftsmen, such as workshops, wine shops, dyeing houses, etc. "Sui Shu. "Shihuozhi": "First of all, Shangyi's disadvantages on the weekend, the official wine shop reaps profits, and the salt wells in Yanchi are forbidden to be used by the common people." "Old Tang Book. "Suzong Ji": "From now on, I have often eaten and served imperial things, and have reduced from feasts, and all workshops have stopped." " Fang" also means a shop. "Zhengzitong. "Tube": "Fang, the place of merchants' trade is also called a workshop." Such as the Northern Song Dynasty Meng Yuan, "Tokyo Dream Hualu. Panlou East Streets and Alleys": "The East Cross Street said from Xinglijiao, the tea shop lights up every five shifts, and Boyi buys and sells clothes, pictures, garlands, collar wipes, etc." Cao Xueqin of the Qing Dynasty, Chapter 23 of "A Dream of Red Mansions" : "(Ming Yan) After thinking about it, he walked to the bookstore." " Fang" means an archway, a building used to commend virtue in ancient times, such as chastity archway, merit archway, etc. Such as Feng Menglong in the Ming Dynasty, "Ancient and Modern Novels. "Xianyun Temple Ruan San pays off the debts": "(Chen Zongruan) took his mother to be a widow at the age of 19, never marrying his whole life, teaching his son to become famous and other things, playing the court, and opening the archway of Jianxian Festival." Wu Jingzi in Qing Dynasty "Outside History" Chapter 48: "Two months later, the boss approved it, the master entered the temple, and the gate was built." It also refers to decorative archways, such as Xu Hongzu's "Xu Xiake's Travel Notes." "Dian Travel Diary 12": "There is an ancient workshop called Yunyin Temple in the mountain gate."

坊字的基本解释

坊
fāng
里巷（多用于街巷的名称）。
街市，市中店铺：坊间。街坊（邻居）。
旧时标榜功德的建筑物：牌坊。节义坊。

坊
fáng
小手工业者的工作场所：作坊。
古同“防”，防范。

坊字的汉语字典释义

[①]［fāng］
府良切，平陽，非。］
亦作“埅2”。
(1)城市居民聚居地的名称，与街市里巷相类似。
(2)别室；专用的房舍。
(3)官署名。隋代太子官署有左右坊、门下坊、典书坊等，唐以后易为太子左春坊、右春坊。
(4)店铺。
(5)手工业者的工作场所。
(6)牌坊。旧时用以表彰忠孝节义、富贵寿考等的建筑物。
(7)铸造器物的土模。
(8)姓。明代有坊蒙。见《正字通》。
[②]［fáng］
［《廣韻》符方切，平陽，奉。］
同“防1”。
(1)堤防。防水或御敌的狭长建筑物。
(2)防范；防御。

坊字的英文翻译

◎ 坊
lane, mill, workshop

坊字的康熙字典解释

【丑集中】【土字部】　坊； 康熙笔画：7； 页码：页225第07
【唐韻】府良切【集韻】【韻會】分房切，?音方。邑里之名。【演義】坊，方也，言人所在之里爲坊。漢宮有九子坊。　又【官僚備要】太子宮曰春坊。【唐書·高宗紀】攺門下坊爲左春坊，攺典書爲右春坊。　又僧寺曰寶坊。【宋之問·登嚴莊寺閣詩】閏月再重陽，仙輿歷寶坊。　又地名。漢馮翊地，唐立坊州。　又姓。見【統譜】。　又【廣韻】【集韻】【正韻】?符方切，音房。障也，隄也。【禮·郊特牲】祭坊與水庸事也。【註】坊祭爲八蜡之一。【經解】以舊坊爲無所用，而壞之者，必有水敗。【坊記】君子之道，譬則坊與，坊民之所不足者也，君子禮以坊德，?以坊淫，命以坊欲。　又【集韻】甫妄切，音放。堤也。　又符訪切，房去聲。【春秋序】聖人包周身之坊。或作防。○按坊、防字義雖同，音切應別。《正字通》合方房二音爲一，幷闕去聲者，非。

坊字的源字形

坊字的起名意思

：里巷，街市，市中店铺、坊间、街坊邻居、作坊。

Basic explanation of words
Fang
fāng
Lanes (mostly used for the names of streets and lanes).
Markets, shops in the city: shops. Neighbors (neighbors).
The building that advertised merit in the old days: the archway. Festival Yifang.
Fang
fáng
Workplace for small craftsmen: workshops.
Gu Tong "defends" and guards against.
Fang
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［fāng］
Fuliangqie, Binh Duong, non. ]
Also known as "埅2".
(1) The name of the settlement of urban residents is similar to the lanes in the market.
(2) Other rooms; special premises.
(3) Official signature. The official offices of the prince in the Sui Dynasty included Zuofang, Menxiafang, and Dianshufang. After the Tang Dynasty, it became the Crown Prince Zuochunfang and Youchunfang.
(4) Shop.
(5) The workplace of the craftsman.
(6) Memorial arch. In the old days, it was used to commend loyalty, filial piety, justice, wealth and longevity, etc.
(7) Soil molds for casting utensils.
(8) Last name. There were Fangmengs in the Ming Dynasty. See "Zhengzitong".
[②]［fáng］
["Guangyun" Fu Fangqie, Pingyang, Feng. ]
Same as "Prevention 1".
(1) Embankment. Long and narrow buildings that are waterproof or defend against enemies.
(2) Prevention; defense.

Пиктофонетические символы.
Значение «почва» означает, что она связана с землей; выражение «клык» (fang) означает, что квадрат имеет региональное значение.
Первоначальное значение - это общий термин для обозначения улиц в городе.
По большому счету, это относится к аркам и мастерским.

I сущ.
1) fāng квартал, терраса; улица; переулок
归义坊 терраса (улица) Гуйи
2) fāng помещение, строение
屯坊列署 складские помещения и разные учреждения
3) fāng лавка, торговый ряд
大茶坊张挂名人书画 в чайной лавке развешаны автографы и рисунки знаменитых людей
4) fāng, fáng мастерская; мануфактура; фабрика; предприятие (также родовая морфема)
染坊 красильная мастерская
作坊 мастерская

典书坊 палата канонических книг (дин. Тан)
6) fāng мемориальная арка
百岁坊 мемориальная арка в честь прожившего сто лет
7) fāng земляная форма (для литья)
炉橐埵坊设, 非巧冶不能以治金 даже имея печь с мехами и земляную форму, неискусный в литье не сможет справиться с металлом (сделать отливку)

然坊与水庸 приносить жертвы дамбам и водам
II fáng гл.
предотвращать, предупреждать; мешать, препятствовать
刑以坊淫 наказывать, дабы тем самым предотвращать разврат
III fāng собств.
Фан (фамилия)
Radicals: 土, 方  (dirt, direction)
Meaning Mnemonic
Can you look at the dirt and know which direction you need to go? Then you might be a monk. Monks have amazing skills like that. And I'm sure you've seen monks wandering around in lots of media. They don't need maps or smartphones. They just look at the dirt and let the earth guide them to where they need to be.
Picture a monk walking through a large field in the middle of nowhere. He knows where to go, he's not afraid. The dirt will lead him in the right direction.
Reading Mnemonic
You want to know the monk's trick so you hide behind him for a while as he walks. Finally the monk stops, looks around, takes out a bowling (ぼう) ball and starts bowling in the dirt. The bowling ball rolls off, the monk follows it, and then heads off in that direction.
Imagine a monk bowling in the middle of the road. Imagine your shock at how well he handles the ball. Also, imagine how heavy it must be for a monk to carry a bowling ball everywhere!
